sentences.en: Blake jumped in expertly; the boat dipped slightly under his weight.
sentences.cn: 布莱克很熟练地跳上了船，他的重量使小船微微向下沉了沉。

sentences.en: Each brick also varies slightly in tone, texture and size.
sentences.cn: 每块砖在色调、质地与大小上也都略有不同。

sentences.en: Each person learns in a slightly different way.
sentences.cn: 每个人学习的方式都略有不同。

sentences.en: He grimaced slightly, obviously expecting no answer to his rhetorical question.
sentences.cn: 他微微皱了下眉头，显然并不期待任何人回答他的反问。

sentences.en: He wasn't irritable or snappy or anything, just slightly perplexed.
sentences.cn: 他并不是爱发火或爱起急什么的，他只是有点困惑。

sentences.en: His family then moved to a slightly larger house.
sentences.cn: 他的家后来搬到了一间稍微大一点儿的房子。

sentences.en: I was slightly afraid of their chilly distant politeness.
sentences.cn: 他们那种冷冰冰的、敬而远之的客套让我有点憷头。

sentences.en: In most languages adjectives have slightly different spellings for masculine and feminine.
sentences.cn: 在多数语言中，形容词的阳性和阴性的拼法略为不同。

sentences.en: My left arm is badly bruised and I was slightly concussed.
sentences.cn: 我左臂严重擦伤，并有轻微脑震荡。

sentences.en: On first acquaintance she is cool and slightly distant.
sentences.cn: 初次相见时她表现冷淡并有点爱搭不理。

sentences.en: She has one slightly withered leg, noticeably thinner than the other.
sentences.cn: 她有一条腿有点儿萎缩，看上去明显比另一条腿瘦。

sentences.en: The bunk mattress was hard, the blankets prickly and slightly damp.
sentences.cn: 这个铺位的床垫很硬，毯子也很扎人，而且还有点潮。

sentences.en: The congregation fell back from them slightly as they entered.
sentences.cn: 教堂会众在他们进来时稍稍往后退了退。

sentences.en: The dog's ears flattened slightly as Cook spoke his name.
sentences.cn: 库克叫这只狗的名字时，它的耳朵就会稍稍耷拉一下。

sentences.en: The pilot throttles back slightly to maintain level flight.
sentences.cn: 飞行员稍稍减速，以保持水平飞行。

sentences.en: There she was, slightly out of breath from running.
sentences.cn: 她在那儿，跑得有点儿喘不过气来。

sentences.en: They will be slightly more expensive but they last a lot longer.
sentences.cn: 它们的价钱要贵一些，可是更加耐用。

words.tran_cn: 轻微的，少量的；脆弱的；细长的；不重要的

trans.tran_en: Slightly means to some degree but not to a very large degree
